credit_line: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund
title: Design for an Oil Lamp.
medium: Pencil, brush and ink, watercolor, tempera colors on tracing paper, tipped down.
description: The body of the lamp is a blue porcelain vase with a central field in the form of an oval containg a bust-length portrait of a woman.  The portrait is enclosed in a bronze frame, flanked by garlands which are tied to the bronze handle mounts.  Bronze base and fixture above holding a glass globe (partly shown.) At lower center: No. 518. Lampe "Cares" pate tendre and Bronze. haut. 74c largeur 40c." (inscribed.)
name: Drawing
